text:

• Destroy target land.
• Search your library for a land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

text:
Flying
Morbid — At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, destroy target non-Demon creature.

editions.flavor: "Avacyn has deserted you. I welcome your devotion in her stead."
"Avacyn has deserted you. I welcome your devotion in her stead."

name: Reaper King
text:
({2/W} can be paid with any two mana or with {W}. This card's converted mana cost is 10.)
Other Scarecrow creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever another Scarecrow enters the battlefield under your control, destroy target permanent.

editions.flavor: It's harvest time.

name: Reaper King Avatar
text: Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.

editions.flavor: SHM Prize Avatar

name: Reaper of Flight Moonsilver
text:
Flying

name: Reaper of Sheoldred
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a source deals damage to Reaper of Sheoldred, that source's controller gets a poison counter.

name: Reaper of the Wilds
text:
Whenever another creature dies, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{B}: Reaper of the Wilds gains deathtouch until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Reaper of the Wilds gains hexproof until end of turn.

name: Reaping the Graves
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

name: Reaping the Rewards
text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
You gain 2 life.

name: Reap Intellect
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose up to X nonland cards from it and exile them. For each card exiled this way, search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Reap the Seagraf
text:
Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: The wreck hung on the jagged reef, each night disgorging more of its gruesome cargo.

name: Reap What Is Sown
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to three target creatures.

editions.flavor: The strength of the people comes from the land. And the bounty of the land comes from Karametra.

text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:

text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)

editions.flavor: Kozilek's brood infiltrates and deceives. The spawn of Ulamog mindlessly consume.

name: Reave Soul
text: Destroy target creature with power 3 or less.

editions.flavor: "I was not convinced you had a soul until I saw it for myself."—Liliana Vess

text:
Rebel Informer can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
{3}: Put target nontoken Rebel on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: The problem with mercenaries is that if you can buy their loyalty, others can too.

name: Rebellion of the Flamekin
text: Whenever you clash, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token. If you won, that token gains haste until end of turn. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

name: Rebirth
text:
Remove Rebirth from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Each player may ante the top card of his or her library. If a player does, his or her life total becomes 20.

name: Reborn Hero
text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Reborn Hero has "When Reborn Hero dies, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, return Reborn Hero to the battlefield under your control."

name: Reborn Hope
text: Return target multicolored card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"In darkness is kindled the fiercest hope."
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

name: Rebound
text: Change the target of target spell that targets only a player. The new target must be a player.

editions.flavor: Insult, like an arrow, is beyond control once loosed.

name: Rebuff the Wicked
text: Counter target spell that targets a permanent you control.

editions.flavor:
"I cannot teach you their brand of magic, but I can teach you how to defend against it."
—Tavalus, priest of Korlis

name: Rebuild
text:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rebuke
text: Destroy target attacking creature.

editions.flavor:

"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Rebuking Ceremony
text: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.

editions.flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.

name: Recall
text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

name: Recantation
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Recantation.
{U}, Sacrifice Recantation: Return up to X target permanents to their owners' hands, where X is the number of verse counters on Recantation.

name: Reciprocate
text: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

editions.flavor:

name: Reckless Abandon
text:
As an additional cost to cast Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.
The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

name: Reckless Assault
text: {1}, Pay 2 life: Reckless Assault deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"How will you fight an enemy that cares nothing for itself?"
—The Blind Seer

name: Reckless Brute
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Reckless Brute attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: His mind knows no fear, registering only the burning impulse to destroy.

name: Reckless Bushwhacker
text:
Surge {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Haste
When Reckless Bushwhacker enters the battlefield, if its surge cost was paid, other creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.

name: Reckless Charge
text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Reckless Cohort
text: Reckless Cohort attacks each combat if able unless you control another Ally.

editions.flavor: "You have a family. Mine died at Sea Gate. You go to yours, and I'll go to mine."

name: Reckless Embermage
text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

editions.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.

name: Reckless Fireweaver
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Reckless Fireweaver deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: Architects find inspiration in the dragon's beauty of form, while artificers are influenced by the function of its fire.

name: Reckless Imp
text:
Flying
Reckless Imp can't block.
Dash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Reckless Ogre
text: Whenever Reckless Ogre attacks alone, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.

Haste

name: Reckless Reveler

name: Recross the Paths

name: Red Cliffs Armada

By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.

name: Redeem
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to up to two target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Let me redeem my brothers both from death."
—William Shakespeare, Titus Andronicus

"That they are saved from death is immaterial. What is important is that they know the source of their benefaction."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Redeem the Lost
text: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Redeem the Lost to its owner's hand. text:

• Counter target blue spell.

name: Red-Hot Hottie
text: Whenever Red-Hot Hottie deals damage to a creature, put a third-degree-burn counter on that creature. It has "At the end of each turn, sacrifice this creature unless you scream ‘Aaah' at the top of your lungs."

editions.flavor: She was winning the Dominarian "Are You Hot?" competition until disaster struck during the wet T-shirt round.

name: Redirect
text: You may choose new targets for target spell.

editions.flavor:
"It's actually quite simple, but since you've only recently begun to walk upright, it may take some time to explain."
—Jace Beleren, to Garruk Wildspeaker

—Veris, watcher of Indi Keep

name: Red Scarab
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by red creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a red permanent.

name: Red Sun's Zenith
text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

name: Reduce in Stature
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 0/2.

editions.flavor: A dragon learns humility only in the moments before its death.

name: Reduce to Ashes
text: Reduce to Ashes deals 5 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: Previously the training center for cathars, the Elgaud Grounds are now used by the Lunarch Inquisition to punish those considered to be heretics.

name: Reduce to Dreams
text: Return all artifacts and enchantments to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor:
"This world is a dream. We cling to our toys like children, but sooner or later we must learn to live without them."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Red Ward
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

editions.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

"In the heart of Llanowar the magic is so strong that trees cannot stay rooted."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning
"Are you crazy?"
The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

name: Reef Pirates
text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."
—Baron Sengir

"Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

name: Reef Shaman
text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: With one gesture, she can render a thousand years of navigational charts obsolete.

name: Reef Worm
text: When Reef Worm dies, create a 3/3 blue Fish creature token with "When this creature dies, create a 6/6 blue Whale creature token with ‘When this creature dies, create a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token.'"

name: Reflect Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to that source's controller instead.

editions.flavor:
From you to me, so me to you.
—Femeref children's taunt

name: Reflecting Mirror
text: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the converted mana cost of that spell.

name: Reflecting Pool
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.

editions.flavor: Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

"The reflection of land interests me far more than its reality."
—Volrath
Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

name: Reflector Mage
text: When Reflector Mage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand. That creature's owner can't cast spells with the same name as that creature until your next turn.

name: Reflexes
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

"Here's how ya win. Don't let the other guy hit back first."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Reflex Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have haste.

editions.flavor:
"This sliver comes into the world a perfect predator. It's ready to hunt and devour its first meal within seconds of hatching."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Refocus
text:
Untap target creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."

text:

name: Refresh
text:
Regenerate target creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
Death is a moth that dances toward our inner flame. The brightest fire can singe its wings.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Refurbish
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"There's no reason to buy a new one when I've got the tools to fix the one you've got."
—Ripu, repair specialist

name: Regal Behemoth
text:
Trample
When Regal Behemoth enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever you tap a land for mana while you're the monarch, add one mana of any color to your mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Regal Force
text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.

editions.flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.
It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.
Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.
Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.
It stalks the Regathan highlands, leaving behind melted snow, scorched earth, and the charred corpses of would-be temple robbers.

name: Regenerate
text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

name: Regeneration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

"Death is not a debt I am yet willing to pay."
—Purraj of Urborg

"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise

name: Regicide
text:
Reveal Regicide as you draft it. The player to your right chooses a color, you choose another color, then the player to your left chooses a third color.
Destroy target creature that's one or more of the colors chosen as you drafted cards named Regicide.

editions.flavor: "You're done!"
